attributes.action: Expectant mothers to receive full maternity pay in the light of Covid-19
attributes.additional_details:
SMP is usually 90% of full pay. However during the pandemic most expectant mothers are placed on furlough which reduces normal wages to 80%. Women whose maternity pay is currently being calculated will then effectively receive 70% of  pay once SMP starts. 
Please help expectant mothers to receive full SMP during & after this pandemic. 

Thank you
attributes.background: Expectant mother’s to receive full SMP pay of 90% of wages rather than it calculated on the 80% currently received on furlough.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the Government has changed the rules regarding Statutory Maternity Pay so that it is calculated based on typical earnings not on furlough pay.

### Further information 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

Find out the latest updates from Parliament on the COVID-19 outbreak, including ways that you can get involved: https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/covid-19/  

Are you an academic or researcher? Find out how you can help Parliament scrutinise the Government’s response to coronavirus: https://www.parliament.uk/covid19-researcher-engagement 


### What the Petitions Committee is doing 


You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
